purpose: The email announces the Call for Papers for the 44th International Conference on Conceptual Modeling (ER 2025), scheduled for October 20-23, 2025, in Poitiers, France. It invites contributions on the theme 'Building Trust Through Conceptual Modeling,' emphasizing the importance of trust in digital ecosystems. The conference seeks original research submissions on various topics related to conceptual modeling, including traditional and emerging areas. Important submission deadlines are provided, along with guidelines for paper formatting and review processes. Selected papers will have the opportunity to be published in a special journal issue.

evidence_sentences: This yearâ€™s theme focuses on the important role conceptual modeling plays in creating systems that are trustworthy, inclusive, and transparent.

We invite the Conceptual Modelling community to deliberate on how traditional modeling principles and frameworks can contribute and adapt to new advancements in AI, data ecosystems, and autonomous platforms while upholding ethical standards and fostering trust in digital innovations.
We welcome submissions of original research on a variety of topics on conceptual modeling, including well-established and emerging areas of research and practice.
Each paper admitted to the review process will be reviewed by at least two program committee members.
The authors of selected papers will be invited to prepare a substantially revised and extended version of a Special Issue in Elsevier's Data & Knowledge Engineering.
